intro: Pimpinella papillare, commonly known as the hairy cow-wheat, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Pimpinella papillare is notable for its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name.
